intro: Indigofera heterotricha subsp. heterotricha, commonly known as the African indigo plant, is a species native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It is a leguminous plant characterized by its trifoliate leaves and distinctive blue or purple flowers. The plant is part of the Fabaceae family, which includes many nitrogen-fixing species, contributing to soil fertility. It grows as a shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its seeds are encased in pods and are used in traditional medicine and as a dye source.
